sentences.english: Zilpah, Leah's handmaid, bore Jacob a son.
sentences.chinese: 肋阿的婢女齐耳帕给雅各伯生了一子。

sentences.english: If a man sells his daughter as a servant, she is not to go free as menservants do.
sentences.chinese: 人若卖女儿作婢女，婢女不可象男仆那样出去。

sentences.english: If a man sells his daughter as a servant, she is not to go free as menservants do.
sentences.chinese: 人若卖女儿作婢女，婢女不可象男仆那样出去。

sentences.english: Do I why the absence for give up the reputation credit and riches of doing the regal concubine as a maidservant.
sentences.chinese: 我何必为一个婢女放弃做妃子的荣华富贵呢。

sentences.english: Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 拉班且将自己的婢女彼耳哈给了女儿辣黑耳作婢女。

sentences.english: Laban gave to Rachel his daughter Bilhah, his handmaid, to be her handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 拉班且将自己的婢女彼耳哈给了女儿辣黑耳作婢女。

sentences.english: Then the handmaids came near with their children, and they bowed themselves.
sentences.chinese: 于是婢女和她们的孩子前来叩拜了。

sentences.english: She saw the basket among the reeds and sent her slave girl to get it.
sentences.chinese: 她看见箱子在芦荻中，就打发一个婢女拿来。

sentences.english: Then the maidservants and their children approached and bowed down.
sentences.chinese: 于是两个婢女和她们的孩子就走近前来下拜。

sentences.english: Then the handmaidens came near, they and their children, and they bowed themselves.
sentences.chinese: 于是，两个婢女和她们的孩子上前下拜。

sentences.english: Then she said unto him, Hear the words of thine handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 妇人说，求你听婢女的话。

sentences.english: And Laban gave unto his daughter Leah Zilpah his maid for an handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 拉班又将婢女悉帕给女儿利亚作使女。

sentences.english: Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 拉班且将自己的婢女齐耳帕给了女儿肋阿作婢女。

sentences.english: Laban gave Zilpah his handmaid to his daughter Leah for a handmaid.
sentences.chinese: 拉班且将自己的婢女齐耳帕给了女儿肋阿作婢女。

sentences.english: Do the same for your maidservant.

definition: imperial concubine or palace maid/imperial secretary (old)
to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
